definition: The art of assigning responsibility to anyone but yourself.
A food group you consider a balanced diet, especially when it's in the form of pizza.
The facial expression you use to hide the fact that you have no idea what's going on.
That thing you have at night that disappears faster than a Snapchat message.
A timepiece you check to see how late you are, but you're always late anyway.
The area around your computer covered in empty coffee cups, snacks, and forgotten dreams.
The outfit you change into when you're too lazy to put on actual clothes.
Something you say to make people laugh, but it usually makes them roll their eyes instead.
The act of pretending to be interested until you can escape the conversation.
The thing that disappears faster than your motivation to go to the gym.
What you pretend to do when the boss walks by and you frantically open a spreadsheet.
The digital trail of your procrastination, filled with unread messages.
A mythical break in the day when you race to eat and answer emails at the same time.
That thing you wish you could do more of but never seem to have time for.
A device that constantly needs attention and makes you forget where you put it.
What you do when you're supposed to be doing something else, but it looks productive.
The facial expression you wear when you've outsmarted the self-checkout machine.
The noise you make when your favorite show isn't available for streaming.
The disappearing act performed by laundry machines that leaves you mismatched.
The sound of no one asking you questions for five minutes, a rare moment of bliss.
A device that keeps the doctor away when thrown hard enough.
A food that proves the existence of a higher power.
Facial insulation for superior thinkers.
A piece of furniture that absorbs flatulence.
The physical manifestation of money's potential.
Amphibious jumpmasters of the animal kingdom.
A dead person with an exceptional attendance record.
A place where you pay to have someone else make your bed.
The only article of clothing you don't have to wash every time you wear it.
A utensil used for precision butter distribution.
A particle that travels at the speed of darkness.
An advanced pointing device for clicking on the wrong icons.
A circle of happiness with triangles inside.
The ruler of a hive or a person who ruins chess games.
A device that plays advertisements with intermittent music.
A creature that carries its home on its back and moves at the speed of retirement.
Bread that had a near-death experience in a toaster.
A fancy word for shadow, preferred by pretentious shadows.
A letter that announces itself and tries to steal the spotlight.
A vehicle designed for transporting kids and their never-ending questions.
The sound a fax machine makes when it dreams of becoming a real copier.
A rich person's bathtub toy.
A horse in pajamas pretending to be a referee.
That thing you pretend to enjoy at parties but secretly hate.
The art of being in a hurry to wait in line.
A vegetable (according to some schools) that's delivered to your door.
A digital message that multiplies like rabbits when you're not looking.
The reason you have a job instead of a nap.
A device that constantly needs attention and rarely makes calls.
A mythical break in the day when you race to eat and answer emails.
The area around your computer keyboard covered in Post-it notes.
Someone who remembers to pay bills but forgets to buy milk.
A person who sneezes silently in a quiet room.
Things you follow until no one's looking.
A bite-sized treat that disappears faster than your motivation.
A social gathering where you pretend to know everyone's name.
A magical elixir that transforms morning zombies into humans.
The act of moving your body awkwardly to music.
What you do with groceries when you don't want to make two trips.
The art of yelling at traffic until it moves.
A timepiece you check to see how late you are.
A muscle that loves dessert more than exercise.
The disappearing act performed by laundry machines.
The sound of no one asking you questions for five minutes.
A small thing you ignore until it hurts.
The thing you're supposed to do twice a day but often forget.
The sound your keyboard makes when you're pretending to work.
The act of staring at a blank screen until coffee gets cold.
The place where Netflix and chill is an adventure.
What you pretend to listen to when someone asks your favorite band.
A device you check for messages and then forget where you put it.
The time you spend in traffic wishing you were anywhere else.
What you pretend to do when the boss walks by.
The thing you check repeatedly when you're supposed to be working.
The sound you make when your mouse is your only company.
What you do when you're supposed to be doing something else.
